body_html:
Quoted from @fmassa in #6766

Another option would be to add an eps before taking the pow.

I'm not sure - there is also the probability of all inputs being epsilon. At least I don't see why the probability of all inputs being epsilon is lower than the probability of all inputs being zero.

body:
Quoted from @fmassa in #6766

> Another option would be to add an eps before taking the pow.

I'm not sure - there is also the probability of all inputs being epsilon. At least I don't see why the probability of all inputs being epsilon is lower than the probability of all inputs being zero.
